resources.string: Know your heart beat rate reading from your wrist band device!
Worry less about your health condition. Get instant update on your health status!
Never getting drunk. Get alert when you are getting drunk!
You can check your alcohol level anytime!

User is alerted about their Intoxication Levels on the Mi-band and via the mobile app
User can connect the device with a group of friends; who are alerted when a member of the group has exceeded their recommended Intoxication Levels.

resources.string: The amount of alcohol and how you drink it affects the level of risk to your health

If you are typically drinking within the low risk unit guidelines, the risks to yout health will be low. No level of drinking is considered risk-free, so the advice is always to consider individual circumstances
Low risk level are Men who do not drink more than 14units per week Women who do not drink more than 11.5units per week

If you are regularly exceeding the low risk guidelines, your risk of short and long term harm to your health increases/ Alcohol related illness includes liver and heart disease, various cancers and stroke.
Increasing risk drinkers include: Men who drink more between 15 - 49 units per week on a regular basis Women who drink more between 12 - 34 units per week on a regular basis

When drinking considerably above the low risk guidelines the risk to your health increases and your drinking will almost certainly harm your health. Compared to non-drinkers you are at a higher risk of developing serious illness and it may be time to take a serious look at how you can cut back
Higher risk drinkers includes Men who drinks more than 50units per week on a regular basis Wwomen who drinks more than 35units per week on a regular basis
